com.github.dm.jrt.android

Class ServiceBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.android.ServiceBuilder

  • public class ServiceBuilder
extends Object
    Context based builder of service routine builders.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 03/06/2016.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServiceTargetRoutineBuilder classOfType(Class<?> targetClass)
      Returns a builder of routines running in a service, wrapping the specified target class.
      In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.
      ServiceTargetRoutineBuilder instanceOf(Class<?> targetClass)
      Returns a builder of routines running in a service, wrapping the specified target object.

    • Method Detail

      • classOfType

        @NotNull
public ServiceTargetRoutineBuilder classOfType(@NotNull
                                              Class<?> targetClass)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service, wrapping the specified target class.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - the invocation target class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • instanceOf

        @NotNull
public ServiceTargetRoutineBuilder instanceOf(@NotNull
                                             Class<?> targetClass)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the application context.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - the class of the invocation target.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

                                             Object... factoryArgs)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the invocation service.

        Note that the built routine results will be always dispatched on the configured looper thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation may result in a deadlock.

        Parameters:

        factoryArgs - the object factory arguments.
        Returns:

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         Class<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         Class<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass,
                                         @Nullable
                                         Object... args)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class by passing the specified arguments to the class constructor.

        Note that inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation. In fact, inner classes always have the outer instance as first constructor parameter, and anonymous classes have both the outer instance and all the variables captured in the closure.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no constructor taking the specified objects as parameters was found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         ClassToken<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationToken)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class token.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         ClassToken<? extends Invocation<IN,OUT>> invocationToken,
                                         @Nullable
                                         Object... args)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified class token by passing the specified arguments to the class constructor.

        Note that class tokens of inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation. In fact, inner classes always have the outer instance as first constructor parameter, and anonymous classes have both the outer instance and all the variables captured in the closure.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationToken - the invocation class token.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no constructor taking the specified objects as parameters was found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         ContextInvocation<IN,OUT> invocation)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified object.

        Note that inner and anonymous objects can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocation - the invocation instance.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no default construct is found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                         ContextInvocation<IN,OUT> invocation,
                                         @Nullable
                                         Object... args)
        Returns a routine builder based on an invocation factory creating instances of the specified object.

        Note that inner and anonymous objects can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocation - the invocation instance.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no default construct is found.

      • on

        @NotNull
public ServiceTargetRoutineBuilder on(@NotNull
                                     ContextInvocationTarget<?> target)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the builder context, wrapping the specified target object.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the invocation service.

        Note that the built routine results will be dispatched into the configured looper, thus, waiting for the outputs on the very same looper thread, immediately after its invocation, will result in a deadlock. By default output results are dispatched in the main looper.
        Note also that the invocation input data will be cached, and the results will be produced only after the invocation channel is closed, so be sure to avoid streaming inputs in order to prevent starvation or out of memory errors.

        Parameters:
        target - the invocation target.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • on

        @NotNull
public <IN,OUT> ServiceRoutineBuilder<IN,OUT> on(@NotNull
                                                TargetInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> target)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the builder context.
        In order to customize the invocation creation, the caller must override the method getInvocationFactory(Class, Object...) of the routine service.

        Note that the built routine results will be dispatched into the configured looper, thus, waiting for the outputs on the very same looper thread, immediately after its invocation, will result in a deadlock. By default output results are dispatched in the main looper.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        target - the invocation target.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
